summary:
The 2012 election was held on November 6, 2012. Democratic President Barack Obama won a second term, beating Republican challenger Mitt Romney. Obama focused on domestic issues and his response to the Great Recession, while Romney criticized Obama's policies.

Obama won 332 electoral votes and 51.1% of the popular vote. He became the first president since Reagan to win a majority of the popular vote twice. This election was also the last time a Democratic candidate won key states like Florida and Ohio. Both Obama and Romney later held significant public offices.
title: 2012 United States presidential election
